questions.question: Which of the following does not represent the Agile methodology?
answers: The software delievery happens all at once at the end
First step is to sit down with the client and make user stories

questions.question: User stories are made in order for:
answers: Communicating and bonding with the clients
The clients to capture a description of a software feature from an end-user perspective
Getting a general notion of what the system should look like
The clients to let us know about their personal stories

questions.question: What are the requirements validation techniques?
answers: Usability testing, peer review, code review

questions.question: The frame story specified requirement x. In the SRS requirement x appeared only partially (there were missing details). What kind of requirements’ error is it?(
What is not one of the Code Review’s Goals?
Which of the following is not a type of review?
Which one is not a phase of system’s life cycle?
Which one is NOT an architectural pattern?
Which of the following is the most correct sentence about testing?
answers: Test-first development is an approach to development whereby tests are written after the code to be tested
Stubs is used in bottom-up integration and driver in top down integration
The acceptance testing is after the system is deployed in operational environment
Stubs and drivers are dummy modules

questions.question: Black box testing and white box testing are?
answers: In black box testing the functionality of the software is known and in white box testing its not
In white box testing the software structure is known and black box it's not
Black box testing and white box testing are the same.
Back box testing is done during the night and white box during the day

questions.question: What is the correct order of testing?
answers: Alpha testing, Beta testing, Acceptance testing
Acceptance testing, Alpha testing, Beta testing
Beta testing, Acceptance testing, Alpha testing
Alpha, beta and acceptance testing are done simultaneously

questions.question: Which of the following is not a kind of maintenance?
Which of the following is the most correct answer?
answers: Corrective maintenance is modifying the system to satisfy new requirements
Perfective maintenance is adapting software to a different operating environment
None of the answers is correct
Adaptive maintenance is changing a system to fix bugs

questions.question: Maintenance predictions are not influenced by:
answers: Number and complexity of system interfaces
Number of inherently volatile system requirements
The business processes where the system is used
Number of code lines the system has
